fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Given a pair of functors U\colon \mathcal {C}\to \mathcal {D} and F\colon \mathcal {D}\to \mathcal {C} such that F \dashv U. We may considered F as a free construction of \mathcal {D} in \mathcal {C}. For any object c \in \mathcal {C}, the category of presentations of c is the comma category {F}\downarrow {c}. The representation of c is the terminal object of {F}\downarrow {c}. This is precisely the object (Uc,\varepsilon _{c}\colon FUc\to c), where \varepsilon is the counit of the adjunction.
